name: lizzie lugo
text: I urge you all to steer clear of Simon McClure. If you are anything like me and suffer from anxiety and depression, he will only make it worse. He completely lacks compassion and refuses to acknowledge concerns regarding mental health. When feeling uncomfortable or that his medical opinion has been challenged, he resorts to belittling. I have never worked with someone that was so narcissistic, egotistical, and overall rude! He places high priority on getting patients in and out of his office faster than one can exhale and then bills for the entire hour block. In the two sessions I have had with Simon McClure, I have left feeling worse than I did coming in. He laughed off my concerns about very addictive medications and did not offer solutions. Also, he told me to adjust medication and wrote the prescription stating the opposite of what was vocalized. This person has no business having access to any medication involving a person’s mental health recovery. If the fact that he  ignored my concerns and then scoffed at a second opinion isn't enough, he made rude comments about my weight and choice of clothing. If you are seeking help, Simon McClure is not the person you should turn to. Find a doctor that cares more about helping you than what is in your wallet. The additional suffering he has created is not worth it and I hope he does not get the chance to derail another person’s life and recovery like he has done to me.

name: BamaBassFinder04 4
text: These people helped me more my first appointment than any of the DR's I've seen in the last 4 years.. Ashley Graves was awesome at listening and trying to help me with my issues!!! Thank u Grayson and Associates

name: Andrea S
text: Dr. McClure has helped me through a very difficult period of crippling anxiety and depression. Unlike other psychiatrists I've seen in the past, he actually listens to me and doesn't treat me like a bad person just because I have mental illnesses. My only issue is that the appointments always feel rushed as they are scheduled 5 minutes apart. That's not nearly enough time even if an appointment is just for a refill and the patient has no problems to address. So I often end up leaving appointments feeling that I haven't had the chance to really discuss each problem as needed.

name: Johny and Shelby Valladares
text: Just had my appointment with my new doctor and as always I felt comfort being there and being able to connect with a doctor and them understand me and what’s going on and what I’ve been through, Dr. McClure is an amazing doctor even though I just had my first appointment with him he took time understanding me and issues I deal with and it felt relieving being able to talk to him it makes you feel like you’re cared about when you have someone that will listen and talk to you about things that can be hard healing from and I look forward to my next appointment, I highly recommend Dr.Mcclure to others and will recommend him to anyone needing a good caring doctor who cares about you and your well being, if I could give 10 stars I defiantly would! Thank you so much Dr. McClure for being my new doctor I feel like a big pressure has been lifted off of me

name: Maria Greguol
text:
My Dr referee me to Dr McClure for therapy, cause I mention that I didn’t want to take meds for my anxiety. This was my first time ever in a Psychologist office, I thought it was going to be pleasant and relaxing. I get to the front office the lady asks me for my referral, to which I tell her that my primary Dr made the appointment and that I was sure they had to have one, otherwise I wouldn’t have gotten the appointment. She then gives me a number To their billing  and tells me to verify with them if they have gotten the referral. I call s and I got a voice mail. I then tell her that I wished they would of let me know about this at the time they send me the text with the appointment info. I was already feeling very anxious.
As I am waiting for my 2:20 appointment ( at this time it was already 2:35) I see the Dr come out and take in another patient, I am thinking, how long is it going to take before I get called in. Then I see o other lady come in to see the same Dr. at this time is like 2:50. So, finally at 3:00, a lady calls my name and not making any eye contact whatsoever, maybe cause she was eating her mask under her nose, says she is the Dr’s nurse and that I have to wait a few more minutes in this other room until he finished with the other patient.
He finally took me in at 3:10 ask me a few questions, prescribed me medication and send me on my way. I was in his office for 16 minutes after waiting almost an hour. Not happy at all

name: chris causey
text: Dr. McClure is a great doctor that listens and helped improve my quality of life tremendously. Just because people can't be responsible with their medication they shouldn't give a bad review.  If I noticed things that didn't work or had side effects I didn't like he would listen and he would change it. I now can actually sleep through the night soundly and can wake up feeling motivated to live my life outside of my house and face the world.

name: Jennifer Cusimano
text: Dr. McClure has been with me during the easiest parts of my life and throughout the most difficult. He has remained a font of wisdom and I do not doubt his summations. In fact my transition between phases of life with his help have gone more smoothly than expected. I could ramble for sentences and paragraphs about Dr. McClure's care. My summary: this man is a good doctor whose judgment I follow implicitly.  You should as well.

name: Martha Lee
text: I saw Dr. McClure on 12/30/19 for a Pre discussed hospital stay the previous week to try electro-shock therapy for ongoing debilitating depression and anxiety that medication only worsens.  I emphatically mentioned to Dr. McClure that I must return to work 1/2/20.  In my anxious state and with great hope that the electro shock therapy would assist in my return to a normal life free of this debilitating condition I thought I would have one session on 12/30 and I would be able to return to work on 1/2/20.  Dr. McClure understood this and never made any comment to the contrary.  I was hospitalized by self admission on 12/30 and was seen by Dr. McClure on 12/31 in the hospital and was told staff were out for the holidays and my first electro shock could not be scheduled until Friday 1/3/20.  I was on Christmas leave from work until 1/2/20 but was willing to take the additional 2 days believing I could return to work on Monday 1/6/20.  Later in the day on 12/31 I met with my hospital social worker and told her I would have to return to work after the treatment on 1/6/20.  The social worker stated “Honey, don’t you know you won’t be able to return to work for 2 weeks, you will have multiple continuous days (6) of electro shock and will then have to be monitored for memory loss before your return to work.”  I stated no, my doctor had never discussed the duration of the treatment and since I had emphatically informed him I needed to return to work on 1/2/20 without any comment whatsoever on Dr. McClure’s part, I assumed that it would be a one day treatment.  I had to request an immediate discharge from the hospital and relayed to the nurse to convey to Dr. McClure my extreme disappointment that he had not informed me of the treatment duration.  If this had been done I could have arranged this at a later date with proper notification to my employer.  I was subsequently informed upon my discharge from the hospital that Dr. McClure stated I need to find another doctor.  This would have been done without Dr. McClure’s request.  Any physician, particularly in a case where a patient is mentally distraught because of continuous depression and anxiety should before any medical treatment is provided to the patient thoroughly inform such patient as to the advantages and disadvantages of such treatment and the full duration of such treatment BEFORE being so recklessly admitted to a hospital.

name: Aubrey Perez
text: My stepmother went to this man whom she followed blindly. He performed 5 electroshock treatments on her against the wishes of her mother and husband and once asperated during one(these were all done with in a week) just to treat paranoid schizophrenia. She later shot herself while still under his treatment. Stay away if you value your life and well being.

name: sandra connell
text: Dr McClure is a good doctor he really listen

name: Cecilia Riley
text: My sister went to dr McClure and she advised him of what was going on with her. He only gave her a ton of med xanax, seroquel, risperdal, and prozac. She can be very convincing he never spoke to any of her caregivers he tried to send her back to work when she says she told him she wasn't ready well let's just say this weekend she almost burned house down and locked us outside and we had to do everything to get in. We have called to get her another dr. I have never heard of a dr not listening to his patients. He has giving her so much medicine that her pharmacy suggest for her to have narcan on standby of possible od. I suggest if you want to get some real help and not a bunch of meds get another dr!

name: The C Show Hosted by Chris
text: Great doctor has helped me alot.

name: BEAUTY GEMINI
text: I have called numerous of times and there is always no answer .I have left messages as well and yet still no call back.

name: Christina Oates
text: Thrive is making such an impact in my life. I love how easy and open the conversations are and how the counselors personalize the “growth” assignments to their clients. They honestly meet you were you are and are honest and helpful about where the next steps are and how to take them on your journey to a better and healthier you.

name: Carly Steed
text: Please do not book a psychiatry appointment here. I was diagnosed with a panic disorder (after being asked vague questions and made to feel uncomfortable) and prescribed a VERY outdated medicine that isn’t prescribed anymore. After speaking to my therapist about not feeling anything, and even feeling worse from the medicine prescribed, I called the office and was immediately told that I could only talk to the psychiatrist in person and would have to pay for another session rather than quickly speak to the psychiatrist about this weird medicine or ask any questions. The psychiatrist would not take questions over the phone. I went to another psychiatrist, and was told that the medicine I was prescribed was one that she had never heard of. Please take the plunge and join the waiting list to see another psychiatrist.

resp.text: While we do stand behind the knowledge and expertise of our psychiatrist, your experience following up was not acceptable. It will be addressed and we apologize for your experience. If you would like to discuss it directly you can reach me on my cell at (205) 743-9251.

name: Sarah Arnold
text: Wonderful counselors who will really listen and do their best to help you.

name: Sam Mayhew
text: Great counciling for all of your mental health needs.

name: Burgandy M
text: Did not want to retain me as a patient. Counselor cancelled appointments. Phone sessions were cut short (counselor disinterested).

resp.text: We never want one of our clients to feel this way. You can contact me directly on my cell at (205) 743-9251 and we will do whatever we need to to make this right.

name: kyle fortenberry
text: The best counsellors work here!

name: Scott Hodnett
text: Wonderful place with great counselors!!

name: Payton H. Stantis
text: When I say that Thrive Counseling & Trauma Therapy has saved my life, I mean THEY HAVE SAVED MY LIFE. The methods that Jeff and his team use to help their clients are different than any type of therapy I have experienced. I spent much of my life seeing talk therapists who would make me feel heard, but that never gave me the tools to handle life's difficult situations. Thrive will hear you and help you figure out concrete ways to handle life's hurdles while providing you with the tools necessary to regulate yourself in any situation. I have been going here for years and have made significant progress on managing emotions, conflict resolution, self esteem, and have processed through multiple traumas. Many of my friends and family go here as well and we are all constantly singing their praises!  If you are ready for some healing contact these wonderful humans because they are the best in the biz! Good luck!<3

name: JustBeingDrè _
text: I have known Jeff professionally for years. We worked side by side, practically sharing an office for about 2 years. He is truly passionate about his work and the healing of his clients. I know for a fact that he will go the extra mile to help clients achieve therapeutic goals, if you are willing to do your part. He is experienced and certified in substance abuse treatment and trauma therapy.

name: Regina Turner
text: Jeff has been helpful as I work through adjustments and anxiety.

name: Theresa Rose
text: I never thought I could get better and not be depressed, until I started seeing Jeff at Thrive a few years ago. The day he was getting married, I had a pretty terrible panic attack and called him, and he spoke with me for 45 minutes and was able to calm me down. Right before they walked down the aisle!!! EMDR helped even though I was skeptical of it. I’m not perfect now, but I’m far from the sad, depressed girl who walked into Thrive suicidal all those years ago. They are wonderful and I couldn’t sing their praises enough!!!

name: Mellissa Goetz
text: Great counseling! Not just someone that will just listen and give metaphors. Actually getting better with each visit. Would highly recommend!

name: Jamie Lloyd
text: Not very pleased,  office staff never gets back to you, and always a battle to get medication refills and PA filled out….. went without meds for 2 months and finally had to find another dr.   Now my son is having the same issues and he is special needs individual

name: Cynthia Squibb
text: She is an awesome dr! She is very knowledgeable and kind; She treats you with respect! I’ve been seeing her for yrs.

name: Steve Livingston
text: Dr. Khusro is a great psychiatrist & the work staff is very helpful. I highly recommend people to see her.

name: Calvert Crane
text: She's a really nice doctor 😁

name: Mitzie Freeman
text: She us an awesome Dr between GOD and her, my daughter is doing awesome. She is a blessing.

name: KDB _
text: Horrible, horrible, horrible. She canceled on me 5 times in a row. She was great at first, then started treating me I was just a burden and started to have a bad attitude towards me for absolutely no reason whatsoever. Started becoming argumentative with me instead of trying to help. Even made fun of my clothes one time! I felt worse about myself coming out of her office than I did going in! I wish I could give negative 5 stars for this quack!

name: LInda Hatchett
text: I am very thankful to Dr. Khusro in how she continues to dedicate time and efforts in working hard with me. I just can't say enough about how much I appreciate her.

name: Tracey Delevie
text: She has taken me off clonzepam after 20 years with no reason....people you can die coming off cold turkey ....so she decides adivan will be better.....OMG it's in the same class of meds. When something works leave it alone...all the people at the CED in the office want her gone.....need Dr Grant back.

name: Jessica Hunt
text: My husband has seen her twice, now mind you he's had about 6 appointments! She cancels last min and does not call to tell you she's canceling, my husband missed 4 hours of work one time to drive 45 mins to get to her office and her rude Secretary tells him that she has to reschedule the appointment. But then she expects you to pay her if you don't call 24 hours a head of time to cancel it! She canceled one time because she was out of town, and another because she had court. One time when my husband went she didn't even talk to him she was on her computer or cell phone the whole time! Now because of the meds she put him on has put him in the ER like her voice recording says to do, the ER did nothing for him told him to call his doc and now I have called her 33 times and left a message, my husband has called her 42 times and left a message. You can't get anyone, you call once and you get a busy signal then call again and it rings to her voice mail! She's pathetic and we will NOT be going back!

name: Dirk Diggler
text: She is by far the worst doctor I've ever seen.  She took me off my nerve meds and now I have nothing. I've had seizures and everything because of this lousy p.o.s doctor

name: BamaGurl73
text: Dr K has done wonders for me...the only bad reviews on here is because she will not prescribe non essential medicines as she is a psychiatrist not a pill pusher

name: Carolyn King
text: Very professional!

name: Genoc Genesis
text: I see Maggie Kellar and her nurse Mackenzie. They are both fantastic and very personable. I drive 45 minutes just to see them specifically. My experience with Mrs.Kellar is the best doctor/patient experience I have ever had. As long as the both of them are there I will always come back.

resp.text:
We appreciate the five-star review. Thank you for taking the time. I share this with the team!
Kindly,
April

name: melody galloway
text: Wonderful clinical staff.  Love love LOVE Dr. Lona!  She's intuitive and kind always.

resp.text:
Melody, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We appreciate your kind words and I will share them with the team.
Kindly,
April

name: Mark Gotschall
text: This place is so much the improvement over the Mobile location.  Miss Anita has always taken good care of me.

resp.text:
We appreciate the review and value your feedback. Thanks for taking the time. I will share it with our team!
Kindly,
April

name: Bernard Doug Cook
text: Seeing a therapist there, Barbara Lee, she's pretty good.

resp.text:
Hi Bernard, thank you so much for the review. I am happy to hear you've had a positive experience at BayView. I will share your feedback with our team!
Kindly,
April

name: Paula D
text: I love this office! I recently had my first appointment there in the office with Ms. kellar. The nurse mckenzie and ms Keller we’re both very kind and i could tell they really cared about me and my mental health. As long as dr kellar and McKenzie are there i will continue to come.

resp.text:
So glad you had a great experience, Paula. I will share your feedback and praise with our team. Have a wonderful day!
April

name: Gail GULF SHORES
text: So far so good for the excellent help I've got online with KATHERINE DAVIS. She is a very compassionate employee,  "goes the extra mile ". So helpful with any questions.  A keeper.

resp.text:
Hi, Gail! Thank you for the five-star review. We appreciate your kind words.
Sincerely,

name: Sandi Cushway
text: They completely changed my medications that I have been stable on for over 15 years (with not ever having to increase ANYTHING).  I have only seen the PA twice and she was pretty nice.  There seems to be little concern for what I, as their patient, am going through every single day as a result of their decisions.  They are making matters worse for me mentally to where I am barely functional at home or work.  The only reason I gave two stars is for the nurse, Anita.

resp.text:
Sandi, I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations. Your feedback will help us improve our services. If there is anything further you wish to add you can reach a member of our patient relations department at info@altapointe.org.
Kindly,
April

name: Billiam Quine
text: They have an issue with making sure their records are up to date. Their staff isn’t helpful and I’m not sure they could be even if they wanted to. Lots of “Its not my problem” going on there. Find someone else to see. Just because they may be the biggest certainly doesn’t mean they are the best.

resp.text:
Hi, Billiam. I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations of care. We appreciate the feedback because it will help us improve our care. If you would like to share more about your experience you can send an email to info@altapointe.org or reach our Patient Relations department at (833) 921-1811.
Kindly,
April

name: Serena kay
text: I found a place where I could get help for my autistic son that's transitioning into adulthood. It's nice to have a place we can call and talk to and get help with medications without coming across as different or weird.  They deal with these things on a daily basis and it feels good to be understood.

resp.text:
Hi, Serena Kay. Thank you for the five-star review. We appreciate you and your feedback.
Sincerely,
April

name: Shae McIntyre
text: First of all it took 3 months to get in to see a nurse practitioner to try to get different medication for my anxiety. Second, I finally get to my appointment and because I have shingles (which is a. Only contagious when the fluid in the blisters are touched but b. All of my stuff was covered and wrapped up) they said they would need to do a full decontamination sweep and I would have to get the clearance from my doctor before I can be seen  . So I spent an hour there waiting just to hear I'm the plague basically. I've never felt so offended. I already cant go to my own brothers wedding because of it but now this. I'm furious.

resp.text:
Shae, I am very sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations of care. Your feedback will help us improve our services. If you would like to provide us with additional information, you can speak to someone in our patient relations department by calling (833) 921-1810.
Kindly,
April

name: Juli Norman
text: Some of the most unkind judgmental unprofessional human beings I’ve ever met. Worst money I ever spent looking for help. Went here due to my doctor no longer being in practice and instead of getting back on my regular medications I Was accused of being under the influence by the NP I saw, being two days post op. She stated “you seem drowsy and irritable” I’m tired and in pain (since I was driving I couldn’t take my pain medication). The woman who took me back for my weight and BP answered her phone and began screaming at someone about what only I can assume was her boyfriend cheating on her. Not a single employee looked at me with a smile or made me feel welcome in the slightest. These woman look at you and judge you, they didn’t even talk to me before I felt like I wanted to run out of that building. I just wish I had read reviews before giving them my money.

resp.text:
Juli,  thanks for sharing your feedback. I am sorry your experience didn’t match your expectations. Your feedback will help us improve. Please feel free to reach out to our Patient Relations department (833) 921-1811 with any further comments, concerns, or suggestions you wish to share.
Kindly,
April

name: Ingrid Hartman
text: My family’s experience has always great!  The location is convenient, the medical staff thorough and the clinicians spend the time needed. Thank you!

resp.text: Hi, Ingrid! Thank you for the five-star review. It is our goal to deliver the utmost in care to our patients and their families so they can live their best lives.

name: Christa Bailey
text: People who come to BayView for help have issues. I was 2 minutes late and had to check in (wait for 6 minutes in line because a computer was down and I was standing there not knowing what to do and nobody would even look at me). I was told that I was 10 minutes late and my appointment is only 20 minutes long so I could reschedule or the doctor would work me in -of course I will have a no-show fee. I have never been here and not had to wait 15 minutes to see doc-I guess it’s a one way street.

name: Samantha Wade Caraway
text: DO NOT GO TO BAYVIEW! THESE PEOPLE DO NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR PATIENTS! They can not even file insurance correctly. If you don't agree with them, they will refuse to do ANYTHING for you. Their only option is to increase meds that do not work or put the patient in the hospital. If I could put ZERO stars, I would!

name: Richard Vin Zant
text: Yeah worst record keeping of any business I’ve been too.

resp.text:
Hi, Richard. I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations. Your feedback will help us improve our services. If you would like to provide any further information, please email us at info@altapointe.org
April

name: Caitlin Shostak Lotz
text: If you feel frustrated and misunderstood by "most" therapists, I would highly recommend Joel. He has a sixth sense for understanding people and the ability to tap into the best thing about them. I have the privilege of knowing Joel personally. I can attest that he is truly a brilliant, imaginative and original thinker.

name: Caleb Young
text: Joel is such a warm, witty and compassionate human being. Anyone seeking a therapist that will truly see you as a person can stop searching cause you’ve find him. 5/5 and I actively recommend to friends and family.

name: Andy Philpo
text: Joel is an insightful and intelligent human being who you can trust to help you process and understand the complexities of your inner self. Come away deeper self knowledge and self mastery, which in turn leads you to a more peaceful life and more fulfilling personal or professional relationships.

name: Andrew Lotz
text: Joel is the most empathetic and intelligent person I know. He has an uncanny ability to understand people. If you need someone to really "get you," this is the place.

name: Wil Heflin
text: Joel Blackstock is a talented, kind, and empathetic therapist. He is clearly passionate about helping others and wants the best for his clients’ outcomes. He is trained in EMDR to help with ptsd and incorporates it along with his years of experience into the process.

name: Jonathan Chesney
text: Joel is thoughtful, curious, insightful, well-trained, and cares deeply about people in general and his patients health and well-being  in specific.  If you’ve been considering therapy and counseling, or just need to talk to someone about how those things might help, I recommend giving him a try!

name: Thomas Kozak
text: No pre-formed assumptions here.  Joel Blackstock meets you where you're at, and he responds to the unique nuances of every individual.

name: Teria Fuller
text: Joel is extremely trustworthy.   I feel free to talk with him about anything and not be judged.

name: Rhonda Hand
text:
I took my Son for his first visit at North Alabama Family Psychiatrist & Counseling, and we were pleased with the overall experience. The Office was very secure with intercom check-in in the hallway. I liked that! It made us feel safe as no one could just walk into the facility without permission. The Office was very clean & had a pleasant & soothing vibe. The check-in was easy and the front office staff was very nice. We were met at the window by Heather, who checked him in. She was very professional & had a warm and caring smile with a positive attitude.  Amber was super nice, very friendly with a great smile and helped take the edge off our nervousness. My Son saw Katy & really liked her! Katy was a good fit for him as she was easy to talk to, made him
feel comfortable & showed a great concern in helping him get better. To this Momma’s heart that means so much! He’s looking forward to his next visit. I’m glad we found this place! The future for my Som just got a lot brighter .

name: That Girl
text:
Amazing doctors and staff. Medical staff seems to actually listen and care about patients, which sadly is a rarity in my experience. Works with you to find the best treatment plan and ensures you are comfortable with it. Very short wait times. Overall great place that I definitely recommend.
Edited to add: I see Katy Frazier who is amazing and have never had problems with the front office staff like many reviews state. I have been going to the practice since spring 2020.

name: abigail johnson
text: I WILL HIGHLY RECOMMEND KATY FRAZIER. As someone who was anxious about talking to a professional about my anxiety and my hardest issues - she helps a lot and she is so patient and you can tell she just genuinely cares. I really appreciate how attentive she is and how I feel like I can openly talk without being judged. So- if you need a professional, she’s very very easy to talk to.

name: Judith Jones
text: Dr. Wilson is very kind and easy to work with.   She listens to my concerns before responding.   In addition, the front office staff with whom I have interfaced have been kind, responsive, and helpful.   Thank you.

name: Heather Martin
text: NP Angela Waldron is extremely in tuned to your needs while providing excellent care!  Angela listens to hear while setting an atmosphere that is comfortable/relaxing.  I highly recommend NP Angela!

name: Courtney Williams
text: I see Angela (nurse practitioner) and she is awesome. She’s very attentive to my needs and what is going to help me feel better. She also makes you laugh and just seems like she genuinely cares what medications are going to help your specific needs. I’m very happy so far!

name: Felicia Fletcher
text: I met with Katy Frazier. She is great! I felt like she understood me. And I was very comfortable talking to her. I would recommend her to anyone!

name: Joshua Evans
text: The office staff is not professional. At least 2 members of the office staff are argumentative, and lack the general professionalism one would expect from a convenience store clerk much less a family psychiatry and counseling center. Those individuals should not be allowed to interact with patients as their combative nature can lead to a compromised metal state in the very patients they proclaim to “treat.”

name: Victoria Ahrendsen
text: Today I had my first appointment w/ Katy Frazier, and she was very kind & understanding. The staff was also friendly. I’d recommend this practice to those of you who are seeking a psychiatric medical provider.

name: Lissette Lopez
text: Seeking help for mental health or behavioral health matters it’s hard to begin with. But then calling in for an appointment and getting someone with a negative attitude on the other End of the line Makes this process harder And dreadful. Which it should simply not be this way. We need more sensible and understanding staff members at these practices. We need people in these offices to care about this type of work and to be understanding of how the person Calling in feels or the situation that they may be in so that they can receive the help they need.

name: Suprenia Waddle
text:
Mrs. Bell is UBER AWESOME !!

Words alone can’t fully express my heartfelt gratitude for your kindness and unconditional support you have shown me. I can finally see there is light at the end of the tunnel.  Thanks to you, I’m on my way back to “happyville” and feeling that I belong among the stars. You have been a blessing in my life. You are that silver lining behind the cloud. When I was ready to throw in the towel, you gave me strength and encouragement to keep moving forward. Thanks for being very attentive over the past six months, I feel the recovery has begun.  I appreciate the positive contributions you are making in my life.  Your advice and guidance is on point and it’s helping me to think through my situation(s) one day at a time.  Your EXPERTISE is teaching/helping me to laugh through my pain. I really appreciate you, you are All that and then some!! I enjoy laughing with you.

name: Austin Ball
text: Katy Frasier is unbelievable ! She has helped me so much and continues to improve my mental health. But I am  continually disappointed in the office staff. I wish they appeared to care about the people that enter their office. God bless!

name: Kai K
text: The actual trained medical staff are wonderful and really care. The front staff can be a little difficult with scheduling and calling you but overall it's a good experience to go. I recommend Katie Frazier! She is absolutely amazing and you can really tell she cares and thinks about you.

name: Jim Williams (CenterFade)
text: Katy is great.  Easy to talk to and seems very interested as a person and not just a patient. Would recommend to anyone.

name: Lyfe LLC
text:
My first experience was wonderful. Dr. Wilson was very patient, professional, attentive, and caring.

I would recommebd this practice for anyone looking for a practice specializing in their modalities.

name: Stacey Gardner
text: The office is terrible. Made several attempts over weeks to get an initial appointment. The provider (Katy Frazier) was awesome and the only reason I will continue to use this place. However, I have had several questions and concerns and have called 3 ..yes THREE times over the past 2 weeks. I've spoken with an office member once, said that I'll receive a return call within 48 hours. That did not happen, I called back and left voicemail. They ask you not to leave multiple voicemails so after 1 week I left yet another voicemail with no return. It's a shame. It is in no way reflective of the provider. I am concerned for the well-being of many of their patients if it is this difficult to get ahold of someone.

name: TeMia Pride
text: Doris Bell is amazing! Was hesitant on going to counseling after a very traumatic experience in my life, but Ms. Doris made me feel right at home from day 1. I am truly thankful for her!

name: A Google User
text: ok, um, i enjoyed the overall experience, and for a presumably cisgendered office, i think they almost made me feel not uncomfortable. now, some things can’t be helped, like my legal name and the way i present as feminine. however, i don’t like the fact that behind my back my psychologist was disregarding my feelings and being downright disrespectful and not understanding of my thoughts while speaking to my mom. eh, what can i say. transphobia is a disease well hidden. that’s all the negative connotations i have. -1 star for transphobia, -1 star for dishonesty.

name: Savannah Pearce
text: Katy Frazier is the only reason I will continue going to this place. She's absolutely amazing with what she does.

name: Bethany Adkins

text: Angela is awsome, I always feel so much better after talking to her. The office is very clean and comfortable also. I highly recomend this place.

ALL THE LADIES AT THE FRONT DESK SUPER DUPER ROCK!!!!!

Nurse Practioner Angela Waldrop is the most awesome there is. Garuanteed  to have a wonderful  experience. Either way, this is a great organization. Some very wonderful people.

text: I love my counselors and therapists. The front desk leaves something to be desired. She is very unfriendly and makes it difficult to get/give messages. I've also had trouble scheduling appointments because she doesn't seem like she wants to be bothered.

name: Terry Ann Kelsoe
text: Dr.Anika Wilson is very easy to engage with. Kind, understanding, and compassionate. I've been to three psychiatrists before Dr. Wilson. Dr.Wilson has helped me more than anyone else. The office staff is professional, kind, and courteous. They have gone above and beyond keeping the facility sterile, and pleasant during the COVID 19. The office staff is faithful to send you reminders of your upcoming appointments. I give them all 5 ⭐.

name: Sonia Payne
text: Great experience. Always very attentive of my needs. I appreciate the helpfulness of the doctor and staff.

name: Megan Lewallen
text: I really enjoy going to North Alabama Family Psychiatrist. I’ve seen Dr. Wilson for years and highly recommend her and her practice!

name: Andre Lenoir Jr
text:
Dr. Anika Wilson is a very profound and thoughtful professional. Dr Anika Wilson seeks to help in the areas that are commonly overlooked based on personal needs. Her direction is clear, precise and progressive. The Staff that within that network/ facility are very patient, informative and supportive. The amount of encouragement by The Team built there is commendable and well organized. Within the best of their abilities/efforts they provide detailed instructions and emphasize the empathy they have for their patients. I am very fortunate to be in their care. They truly believe in the well being of their community. Thank You.
Andre’

name: Jacqueline Reaves
text: Angela always provides outstanding service

name: Jane Craig

name: Cheryl McCoy
text: They are very professional, helpful, and discreet.  The office staff is so nice and personable. And my doctor is really interested in me and making sure I get better.

name: Diana Johnson
text: They’re very professional they’re taking extra precautions with COVID-19! I feel they listen to me and my issues and they actually care about my mental health!

name: Mary Headley
text: Words cannot express how grateful I am for this office. Heather Love answered our call when we were in a crisis and worked us in. We saw Angela Waldrop CRNP and she is the best. I highly recommend their services. Thank you so much for all you do!

name: Keshun Morgan
text: My son has been patient there for years and consistently we have seen dramatic improvement.  Dr Wilson has the perfect balance as it relates to professionalism, personality, and genuine care for her patients.  As a bonus she is a GREAT psychiatrist...I trust her judgement and recommendations unequivocally.  If I can trust her with my son...you can to.  Thank you Dr Wilson and the NAFPC team!!!

name: Zoe Terry
text: It’s a very welcoming environment. Dr.Wilson is an amazing doctor. She’s changed my life!

name: Chris Amos
text: Very professional, friendly and thorough 😊👍

name: Lynda Smith
text: Awesome very caring and understanding.

name: Melissa Kelly
text: If I could give negative stars, I would. This place used to be great. I saw both Harmony Rose (NP) and James Taylor (LPC), and they were both great. I will continue to see James at his new location, and will be going elsewhere to replace Harmony who moved out of state. The office staff used to be really organized. However, there has been a lot of changes and turnover. As a result, the people are completely incompetent. I showed up for my last two appointments as written on my appointment cards just to find out that they didn't have me in the system for an appointment. The lady who helped me was the same each time, and she had the guts to tell me to make sure it was written on a card next time (WHICH SHE DID THE LAST TIME!!!!!). They also randomly started filing my insurance wrong, resulting in a copay that I had never had before. Despite bringing this up multiple times (including pointing out that my insurance said that the claims needed to be refiled and the provider had been notified), the claims have not been refiled, they continue to charge me a copay, and I haven't gotten my money back. I hate just how terrible this place has become considering how much I loved going there before.

name: Aryn Philip
text:
Dr. Rose was amazing to meet with. She listened so intently and was so sweet, patient, and kind. You could tell she really cared about my treatment. I'm so happy I made my appointment.

I will say that the people at the front desk could be a bit more personable, but that is a very minor note. Also, no food or drink is allowed, which is kind of a bummer!

name: Megan Determan
text: Everyone at this clinic has taken excellent care of my children. They are amazing!

name: Petrina Allen
text: I enjoyed talking to the NP she was very helpful and understanding of my needs and concerns.

name: Kendra Castillo
text: Dr Geist is very knowledgeable and professional! Would highly recommend this office.

name: Sarah Hymas
text: We have been seeing Dr Wilson for several years. She is a great listener and is persistent in solving problems/adjusting meds to ease our son’s difficult challenges. We are so glad we found Dr Wilson!

name: LASHAY WATWOOD
text: They have the best customer service in Madison. I left my old clinic due to the rude customer service. However, the lady that helps me when I go in is the absolute BEST. If I recall correctly her name is Amber. She is amazing.

name: Gina F.
text: The first woman I met with had great bedside manners and seemed to genuinely care about my well being. When she left the practice I was asked if I wanted to see Dr. Wilson. I said "yes", expecting a similar experience. What I received was someone who seemed cold and somewhat callus. I tend to get very emotional when I talk about my past and my depression, but I did not feel comfortable or safe in her presence at all which only exacerbated the issue. She prescribed a medication that almost put me in the hospital. She was condescending and rude whenever I questioned her diagnosis. After a few sessions, I called to cancel my next appointment. Not a single person from that office called to check on me whatsoever since that time. It really showed me how much I and my well being meant to them.

name: Ronald Price
text: Outstanding Dr and staff. Highly recommend.

name: Mallory Jackson
text: I have loved this practice since I came to them over a year ago. Dr. Wilson has changed my life and some days I wonder if I would still be here if it weren't for her.  The pracitce is growing and for good reason! Sometimes businesses go through growing pains and I could tell this had happened today at my appointment. Somehow I was not on the schedule, which has never happened before. But Dr. Wilson took the time to see me and was so attentive. She made it right even though someone else  made a mistake (someone that no longer even works there). Another reason I will continue to use Dr. Wilson as long as I can. I can not stress how amazing she is!

name: shone Tapscott
text:
I like Dr. Wilson and her staff.
She was very friendly to me and really seemed caring.
Her Front office staff is the best staff she has had since I been there as a patient. Thank you to NALfPC.

name: Kahlo Paints
text: Dr. Wilson is the opposite of what someone in mental health care should be.  She is cold, distant and uncaring.  She cut me off when I would try to explain my problems and I could tell she was irritated if I tried to ask her questions about my treatment.  The office staff won't return your calls, they are rude and if they can find a reason to charge you for something, they will. Beware, this place made me worse, not better.

name: Stacy t
text: I couldn’t rate this a zero so a 1 will do. In truth I couldn’t even get to an appointment , this is all based on just getting started . I called and made an appointment a few weeks back . Unfortunately I have to have surgery, and had to reschedule . My appointment ( made in Aug) was for Sept, upon calling and being placed on hold not once but twice for over 10 min I called back and the first time had to leave a message ( no one returned my call), the second time I finally got someone , and was told it would be now 2 more months to be seen ! Obviously this practice is too big with not enough help, for how does extending by months help a patient ?!? I told them forget it , cancel the appointment I will find someone else. So based upon this , I wouldn’t go here .. they don’t care , they just put you on a never ending hold and hope you’ll go away ...

name: H Luthy
text: We are new to Dr. Wilson's practice but have been very happy so far. She is upfront, explains her thoughts and recommendations and takes our intuition and experience into consideration. While she is very pleasant and polite, she isn't super warm and cuddly. But we aren't there for a best friend we are looking for someone to make professional and non-emotional decisions regarding the care of the situation.

name: Kristen Gaufin
text:
I am extremely disappointed with my experience here. I had my son tested for ADHD with Dr. Geist and the cost was grossly underestimated. I was told it would be $600 w/o insurance but continue to receive bills in excess of that. In addition, I was charged an additional $150 just to spend 5 minutes going over the results, all without informing me first. Seems like an unethical way to do business. Testing should come with results and if for some reason you see fit to bill them separately, you have an obligation to inform the client FIRST.

I was also unimpressed with Dr. Wilson when taking my 10 year old in to be evaluated. She hardly looked at him, spent most of her time typing away on her computer, and then sent us on our way with a prescription I did not want.

I will not be returning to this office and would urge others to seek services elsewhere.

name: Steve Trent
text: Don’t come here unless you want them to bleed you dry. I received improperly labeled appointment cards TWICE, which they’re charging me $120 for and did not receive the text appointment notifications I signed up for both times either. I would call to confirm appointment times not only to receive their voicemail, but to never receive a callback when I left a message. I’m on a maintenance dose of my medicine yet they won’t write refills unless I come in and pay $30 every month. DO NOT COME HERE. I would give them 0 stars if I could.

name: Jeff Bourland
text: As someone who has a chronic illness, I have had a hard time finding a psychiatrist that was understanding of the emotional problems that living with a illness poses. Dr. Wilson was the psychiatrist I had been looking for. She was not only knowledgeable but committed, on day one, to aggressively get my emotional problems under control. She is someone who gets the job done and is fully committed to your needs. I feel very fortunate to have found her and am grateful for her services.

name: Amy P
text:
I understand why some people have given negative reviews. There seems to have been a lot of changes recently and I assume they are for the better. They do seem to be understaffed, but are working on the issue.

I receive Nuerostar TMS treatments from Dr. Wilson. They have changed my life! I don’t remember a time in my life when I didn’t struggle with depression and have tried many medications over the past 15 years with no real improvement, until TMS. I am “officially” in remission from depression, I honestly didn’t think that was possible!!!! To me, the fact that they offer a treatment with little to no side affects that actually works is a life changer.

name: Jacob Torrence
text: Dr. Wilson is exactly the sort of person that I think should be doing this kind of practice. Several reviews mention her reserved personality and say that this is a negative trait, but those who suffer from mental illness don't always need someone who just agrees with them to make them feel better in the short term. The motivation to change never comes from staying in a place of comfort. Dr. Wilson is the kind of person who will be blunt enough to keep your attention while she tells you what needs to be done.

name: carston truumees
text: Loved dr.wilson! Way better then nova center in Huntsville

name: Iggy Tate
text: Harmony Rose is wonderful. I highly recommend!

name: Sandra Carlton
text:
This dr, has no care for her patients,she’s mixed drugs that should had been avoided being used together. Never called me when I left a message stating I was going off of a medication due to side effects as well.
.Seems she’s in it for the money. Just doesn’t seem to care. Pushy. I don’t recommend her in my opinion.

name: Jackie Burruss
text: Everybody was very  professional and kind

name: Jana Pettus
text: I think she's great. She doesn't coddle her patients or waste my time. She listens to me when I tell her my medication preferences, and I've been doing great on her medication suggestions.

name: Brandi Key
text: I've been seeing Dr. Wilson for approximately two years now and I have not been dissatisfied. At first, I was put off by her reserved demeanor but as someone else said, she is not there to be my new BFF. Once you have seen her a couple of times, she does become a "real person". Also, at first, I felt she was very quick to prescribe meds but then again, she is a psychiatrist and that is how psychiatrist do their part of mental health. I only have two issues with the practice; she tends to run late and they are very very strict about their cancellation policy. I can understand the need for it but they should also realize that emergencies happen in life. If an emergency happened on her part, we don't get a free session out of it so why are the patients given the same leeway at least once or twice a year? It is my understanding that this is the practice's policy and not Dr. Wilson's, so I can't fault her but it is a hassle to pay the late cancellation fee when the cancellation was unavoidable.

name: Gina Gonzalez
text: Dr. Wilson does not have you’re best interests at heart. She is harsh, uncaring and bordering on hateful. Beware.

name: Jenniffer Olvera
text: Horrible place, do not go there!!!!!

name: Katie D.
text: Similarly to others, I've been seeing her for 3+ years with no improvement or results. She prescribed a plethora of medications that at times caused suicidal ideation. Wilson responded poorly to my worse times with lack of empathy or care. It has been like walking on eggshells because she is flippant. She guilt-trips you into staying as her patient and told me I would never get off medication. I would NOT recommend this psychiatrist.

name: Mariah Faith
text: She has bad bedside manners and gave me the wrong diagnosis for years. Put me on medication that made me suicidal and told me if I stopped taking it she wouldn't see me as a patient any longer.

name: Julie Cronan

He made me feel like he was really listening to me and I felt like he really put some thought into what medication would be best for me. He thoroughly explained what the medication was and what the possible side effects could be. This was the best experience I have ever had with a doctor before.
