text: I have been with them for over a year, almost every time I have to refill my meds it's a literal nightmare. They mess up the meds order in every way you can think of, it's always the same too. The med is incorrect, not the right amount and takes at least a weak to even fix the issue. I'm finding a different one, because this is just nothing but a big inconvenience.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear about your experience, if you would provide me with your contact information I would be happy to discuss this situation with you to find a reasonable resolution. you can email me at psychalabama@gmail.com

name: Chalis Love
text: Unfortunately I did not have a great experience with my "therapist". Wish I could say better , I was meeting with Pamela Callaghan for therapy, I had missed a scheduled visit and received a NOT SO HAPPY call from Pamela, she stated she wish I would have called the office to cancel instead of missing the virtual appointment I told her I wanted to pay for my previous bill first to which she replied " Are you still working?" I answered yes. She asked if I was still taking medication i replied yes for anxiety and she said " SOUNDS LIKE YOU NEED ANTIDEPRESSANTS" . Its nice to know if your at work and miss a virtual visit with your therapist you will be judged and labeled depressed with no Apology. Would not recommend.

resp.text: I am very sorry to hear about your experience, would you like a call from the manager?

name: Lisa Hallmon
text: I wouldn’t even give one star. My mom was admitted to Shelby Hospital for psychological reasons. She could walk and talk before entering. After being put on extreme medication from Alabama Psychiatry facility, my mother couldn’t talk nor walk. She has been in the hospital now for over a month. She is finally talking and her mind is coming back slowly. She still can not walk. She has been to 3 hospitals where they said my mother was highly over medicated and she has Parkinsonism from way to much antipsychotic medication. Alabama Psychiatry Doctors put her on all them. This has been so hard. I am now dealing with depression and stress as well over all of this. Do not let your loved ones go to this place! They will way over medicate. I also had spoke to the doctor about feeling that my mom was way over medicated and she just Dropped her down one dose but then added an antidepressant.  It’s been a complete change in my moms life. A horrible change!!! Another hospital is trying to get her medication corrected where hopefully she will be able to get back to normal and walk again

name: Bree B
text: Dr. Chowhurdy is an angel. I have been seeing psychiatrist for ten years, and she is the first I’ve felt truly comfortable being open with. She saved my life, and in turn I will now be well wnough to be a wonderful mom

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review

name: Lana Farley
text: I have had a awesome experience with Dr M he's listens n cares I couldn't ask for more

name: Taylor Simmons
text: Dr. Dumas refuses to listen. She would not give me the time of day to explain my daughter's behavior. Therefore, I will no longer be taking my daughter to her.

resp.text: We apologize if we were unable to satisfactorily meet your needs,  I will notify the office manager.

name: Kylee Pickle
text: If it were not for the doctor I see I would certainly go somewhere else!  The front desk “girls” do not know what they are doing nor do they know how to treat people with respect and dignity.  If you have opportunity to actually get them on the phone!!  The “girls” in the billing department are not any better if not worse! They never call back when messages are left and again if you ever get them on the phone! We work just as hard as they do for pay and when insurance is filled wrong and a bill is received saying you owe a certain amount for a visit when the last two years my insurance covers 100%?  I’m going to call and question what the problem is and expect a professional to handle themselves the way they should when they work in a doctor’s office!

resp.text: I will refer this to the office manager.

name: Nicole Kennel
text: The providers are great when you can get in to see them. However, the entire place is useless if you need anything outside the appointment. They don't answer phone calls. Take weeks to respond to messages, and if you need paperwork filled out for any reason, they are super unhelpful. Been with them for years, but this has become there norm. I will be looking for another practice as soon as I can.

resp.text: I'm sorry that you haven't received the care that you expected, if you would like to discuss it please email me at psychalabama@gmail.com

name: Kenneth Larkin
text: Dr. Chowdhury and her staff are the most caring compassionate medical professionals I have EVER had the pleasure of working with. While all the others were concerned about me having insurance and "unable to schedule without" this practice immediately recognized my needs and were able to see me the same day. Dr. Chowdhury took the time to listen carefully and understand what was happening and offered very effective treatment options. If you need this type of care, do NOT hesitate to reach out to these professionals. The exemplify the standards of care. I am thankful for being able to connect with them and certainly have a new "perspective" on my life. Thank you so very much Dr. Chowdhury

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!

name: Lori chapman
text: I have been trying to get my meds  correct for 2 months now. They are not good about sending p.a.s in. I have told them since September I have no more visits left so I can’t schedule a visit until January after speaking to aHolly several times she said I should hear back from her by Tuesday. It is Friday, and when I called the said Holly was busy they were transferring me to the nurse where nothing is done correct I go over again what has been happening she put me on hold and came back and said the dr would come back to talk to me. He did call. And at 2:50 I was send an email saying I confirmed my appointment this morning at 9:20. I never requested an appointment cause I am out of visits and they new that. Now they want money. Well they won’t get it I only receive 221.00  a month they get nothing and they have lost a patient. I would never recommend this office

resp.text: I'm sorry we've been unable to help you. Best of luck you.

name: Brooklyn Hallman
text: Dr. Chowdhury is great! She is always very polite and it’s clear she cares about her patients.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.

name: Christina Hill
text: I have met with Dr. Chowdhury twice virtually and she is warm and caring and listens to my concerns. You can tell that she cares about her patients. Everyone I have talked to at the office has been very helpful as well. Definitely recommend Dr. Jaria Chowdhury and this office.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, we appreciate the review.

name: Bama Fan2019
text: The Dr’s are very helpful and nice but your front office staff other than the 1 lady that I believe is new is horrific. The dark hair young lady that checked me in when I got there was just as nice and pleasant as she could be. The heavy set blond lady was VERY rude about my account talking to me in front of everyone about my balance. This is something that should be kept private. When I was leaving and trying to reschedule my next appointment I had to wait because the only person in the office was the nice young lady that checked me in. She had phones ringing and other customers checking in and no help. Finally the second lady came in with a attitude. The owner of this business needs to come in and do some house cleaning in the front office except for the dark hair young lady, she was the only bright spot of your business. Hope I never deal with the rude blond lady I think her name was Valerie or something like that. Very sad service!

name: Chris Johnston
text: Worst place ever. The young lady at the window was very kind however, she is the only bright spot. Other were standing around talking while everyone in the lobby was standing in line. The last 3 times I have been in there your billing has been screwed up saying I owe money. I’ve learned to just bring my credit card statement with me. Service is the worst I have ever seen.

name: Jean-Paul Bootier
text: Great staff and wonderful doctors. Never had a bad experience

name: Rhiannon Perkins
text: This was the most disappointing experience I have ever experienced EVER! I’ve been to some sh*t doctors before but I’ve never had to deal with such idiocracy before in my life. My husband was a patient with them and has had great success so I made an appointment after hearing good reviews from him and also another family member. I made an appointment a week before and two days before they called to tell me that they had to change my doctor due to a “conflict of interest”. Meaning it was my husband’s therapist and they wanted me to see the other therapist available. I agreed and set the appointment for later in the day. The day came for my appointment and I receive a call from the therapist saying that she wouldn’t be able to see me either for the same reason even though my other family member had STOPPED seeing her. She said she would call me back after I told her to go ahead and cancel my appointment. Never received a call. I showed up at the office 30 minutes early and she asked to see me in her office where she tried to further explain the “conflict of interest” that they kept referring to. I told her I could find a place closer to home that wouldn’t turn someone away who was looking for help. If you’re thinking about going here, make sure no one you know is a patient as well. Otherwise, you might become another “conflict of interest” like me and not be told until you show up because even though they say they called you and got your voicemail. I guess actually LEAVING a voicemail is too complex. I’m not doubting their ability to help, but being turned away at the door when you want help feels like an emotional slap to the face.

name: T Farris
text: The initial physician was great but after that downhill.  I was never told that I would have to have numerous appointments in order to get the testing completed. My appointment with the intake physician was changed 3 times and the last time was due to their issue with getting a THEIR new physician set up.  Still not sure how that is the patient's problem. All I was told was I could go elsewhere but the wait was going to be long. Not really because I was able to get into their office.  Unreal canceled everything and WILL NOT RETURN OR RECOMMEND.  If I could leave 0 stars I would.

name: Devin “Gearhog” Payne
text:
I left an extremely emotional, long, desperate email on my appointment request, and got a call back only a couple days later. The woman I spoke to was kind and genuinely concerned about my well being. She was a little absent minded but that's what I loved about her! Softly humming tunes while trying to track down information, "talking to herself" when she found something ("oh! There it is!" etc)  It made me feel at ease.
I don't know why the reviews are so bad for this place... I've had an amazing experience so far.
As someone who suffers from varying mental disorders, as well as being victim to multiple emotional & sexual traumas, I find it exceptionally difficult to trust; yet I already trust Dr. LaRussa. It's such a relief to finally meet a mental health professional who can see me for who I truly am, and that I'm comfortable enough around to be myself.
Even though he's a psychiatrist, he listened to my rambles and my talking in circles. He offered practical theories, and gave solid advice.... And he seemed to really understand me, suggesting we find a therapist to treat my PTSD. He spoke to me like I'm a human being.

I've only had one appointment so far but Dr. LaRussa is sooo fantastic! He and the rest of the staff seem to genuinely care about the patients. I look forward to my next appointment with him.
If you're someone who's easily threatened, this man is the doctor for you! I've met so many, and none even half as compassionate as Paul LaRussa. His gentle smile alone would make anyone feel at ease.

name: ben guthrie
text: Jennie is great! She's helped me tremendously.

name: Janice Mutchler
text: Inefficient, no regard for customer's time. Waited over an hour to see Dr for a scheduled appointment. Another patient in the waiting room with us signed in and waited an hour and a half, asked what the problem was and only then they figured out her appointment was scheduled for the following day.

name: Haley Davis
text: I went to see Dr. Bodiford for help with my ADHD and instead I was told I'm "too smart" to have ADHD via an IQ test, and I must only have dyscalculia instead. After going to another psychiatrist for a second opinion, I was told I absolutely have ADHD and that IQ tests are not at all a way to determine if a patient has ADHD. I went three years before seeking this second opinion, and in those three years I have struggled with my ADHD more than ever. I am so thankful for the ADHD Clinic in Hoover because Alabama Psychiatry failed me.

resp.text: We apologise if your expectations were not met.  Would you like to speak with the office manager?

name: Lea Roberts
text: Jacob Scott was very kind to me at a time when I needed help.   Covid caused a change in how they delivered care, but it was seemless.   Leigh Ann has been so helpful.   It is a humbling experience to need help...but they never look down on you and truly care about their patients.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.

name: Chason Burdick
text: Great doctors i really have come a long way with their help they are very caring and careful  love my dr Jacob Scott hes helped me more than he knows I did leave a review that was i thought confidential listing only one issue I had then I got a termination of care letter  I love Dr Scott hes helped me through alot and I pray in his heart that he will see that I really need him and his care more than he ever would know

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.

name: Nvision Xchange
text: Dr. Scott saved my life. Lou East

name: mandy reiter
text: I have used this practice for awhile and absolutely love my doctor, she is fantastic! The staff has had some turn overs and sometimes it is a pain to get refills but the quality of patient care is what is important and I am completely satisfied.

name: Dorothy Montgomery
text: This place is wonderful. They are very professional and friendly. I had addiction issues. Dr.Ram was very nice and non judgmental. He was very understanding about my addiction and worked with me. I can proudly say that I am sober for 3 years and I am a totally different person. Me and my family will always be very thankful to Dr.Ram and River Region Psychiatry.Thank you Dr.Ram......

name: Paul Brehm
text: They came highly recommended by a good friend, but I can’t speak to their services or staff because they quite literally never answer their phones or return your messages. Don’t waste your time here.

name: jennifer pilgrim
text: Horrible place. If you have anxiety don't go here they will make it worse. Especially the lady who handles the prescriptions.

name: Amber Worthington
text: Only people who have helped me. Very polite and professional... Just wish they were available to answer the phones during the day.

name: sarah taylor
text: My experience there was not good. The woman upfront has an attitude, if you need a medication refill the nurse will tell you the doctor is out of the office for a week, they will bill you for a charge your not responsible for, and once you see the doctor he doesn't communicate. He was actually yawning while I was talking and showed no interest in what I had to say. He would give me more medication than needed so I wouldn't have to come back so I just stopped going. Although I had insurance and didn't do anything to anyone I guess I wasn't interesting enough to receive treatment.

name: Shaneeda Staples
text: I had to edit my review because after dealing with them for a few years, this is what my experience is.(This review is for the main office on Sydney Curve.) They don't let you know when your doctor/therapist leaves your insurance network causing you to rack up a large bill. They've forgotten me more than once, letting others go back to see the doctor before I do. Back before the old office manager left, I asked them for over a year what's going on with my daughter's copays. I couldn't get a straight answer. Their billing department has been a hot mess. Saying one thing, doing another. They let a large bill rack up and now she can't see the doctor for her meds. The doctors/therapists are great but billing and the receptionists (except Quintella) are a disgrace to anyone in customer service. I'll be so glad when they're paid off. I don't recommend them to anyone. You've been warned...

name: Andrew Rolfsen
text:
This place never answers their phones, doesn't call when they cancel or reschedule your appointments, doesn't fill prescriptions on time and over bills all their clients. To say that their office manager is incompetent is to say the least.

And lol at all the employees leaving positive reviews on google. It's a shame when your staff has to boost your review levels

name: Brooke Davis
text: Only been seeing the Dr's here for a short time, but so far everything has been great!

name: Kelly Parvin
text: The front desk is strangely unwelcoming. We attempted to receive care from our therapist when they relocated to this office. The atmosphere is toxic and our sessions were unproductive. I’ve never experienced anything like it in a therapy setting.

name: tameka williams
text: Your sessions will be discussed throughout the office instead of being kept confidential.

name: Tahsin Siddique
text: They r friendly but expensive. ..

name: Yeyette Laster
text: Megan Lealy, you are so right about the front desk clerk and there are also a couple of other people on her level which is sad.

name: Sanjay Kapoor
text:
Dr. Alrefai is a nice guy, in my opinion the best psychiatrist in town. He is religiously devoted, always says things the softest and most pleasing way possible, and though the meetings are generally just him listening for 5-10 minutes and then giving you the same prescription and not truly helpful, he is very human which is a tall order for many psychiatrists lol

I will say though, probably 10-20 times we called to set an appointment because I was out of medicine, not once did we get a callback. My mom was very distressed for a day or two until we could drive there each time -- a very jarring experience for her

name: Sandy Norwood
text: I have been going to Valley Behavioral for just over a year, it has been a life saver.  The staff are always polite and are willing to work with me scheduling appointments.  I have been seeing Keith Watts and regardless of any problems I have, he is more than willing to help me get a better perspective and I always leave laughing and feeling better.  My phone calls have always been returned.  I'm so very happy I found this office.

name: Stephanie Nissan
text: I'm grateful for everyone at Valley Behavior.. From the busy staff that cares, The encouragement from Phoebe Horton & the best guidance for addiction from Keith Watts.

name: Andi Brown
text: I am so grateful for Dr. Al and his office. Crystal checks me in each visit. She is so kind. I can see her smile even behind her mask. Dr. Al has been a God-send. He treats me as if I’m his only patient. I’m feeling so much better since coming to him. The most helpful person is Shannon. She talks to me and helps me feel better each time I visit the office. She treats me like a friend!!  I thank them all!!

name: anonymous smith
text: This place is the worst and deserves no stars. Very unprofessional

name: Sean
text: Dr. Ammar Alrefai (Dr. Al) is helpful and a pleasure to work with.  He stays current on new innovative treatment options and has a wonderful staff.  He's been taking care of me for years.

name: Kimberly Craig
text: I got there 30 min prior to my appt time for paperwork.   I was called back right on time to see Michelle Pratt.  She was very nice and explained her questions if I didn't quite understand.  I was in a really bad place and she talked to me, asked questions and prescribed me different meds since the ones id been taken for over a year just wasnt helping me anymore.  She expressed her concern for me and asked to see me back in 2 weeks and also set me up with a therapist.

name: QD.
text: Absolutely terrible. The office never calls back when scheduled and will not pick up the phone at all. Multiple messages left. No proper response. If you have any medical needs. This is not the place.

name: Heather Addison
text: I was getting ready to make an appointment with this doctor with all the good reviews. Then I read the one about the woman who experienced Michelle Pratt. I had to deal with her at Valley Behavioral Services. She is a horrible person! I felt traumatized by my encounter with her. She refused to approve the refills I needed to keep me from going through withdrawals and was just so hateful I left and never went back So, if she is at this doctor's office, I guess I'll have to keep looking.

name: Sharon Fortenberry
text: I think the person who gave a number one as a rating  was not speaking of our Dr, A.  Our Dr. A is a “he” not a “she.”  One should be very careful when giving someone a bad rating and review.  One should make sure you are evaluating the right person.  Our family is extremely happy with this physician.  He definitely has the right characteristics one needs to be a physician and especially a psychiatrist.  We have used this office and physician since 2012.  Nothing but the highest professionalism in the office and Dr. A definitely deserves a 5 star rating.  I am a retired healthcare professional and highly critical of less than standard care.  This office and physician meets the highest standards for excellence.  I hope my rating will be seen to off-set the bad rating.

name: Haley *
text: Dr. Alrefai is an amazing doctor! He has kept me stable for a while now and I’m feeling great! I’ve had no issues with his office staff and his office is very comforting to be in. I highly recommend Dr. Alrefai and his staff!!!

name: garrett fairley
text: Dr. Alrefai cares about his patients and isn’t one of those revolving door doctors who just writes a prescription and runs you out the door. He listens to you and provides treatment options to you and makes sure you understand why he suggests it and what the medicine does to help you. I recommend him highly.

name: Bonnie Bahney
text:
There are numerous Dr. In this office, my son  saw a different dr . He has been going there almost two yrs
The price went from a $100.00 , last year $125. 00 now  this month to $150.00 plus pee test plus counseling, about 350 00  they are good drs.  They don't take Medicaid, so unless you make good money,( but please pay your rent first) it a very good place. My son was so much better under their care, but I can't afford it.  It is cheaper to by drugs off the street.  Good luck people, hope you can get the help you need.

name: stacie hughes
text: I love Dr Al! He's patient and understanding. He has not only helped me mentally but physically. I believe he has saved my life! I lost over 25 pounds, no appetite, two different doctors couldn't figure out what was wrong but Dr Al helped me and I am eating well and slowly gaining weight again! Excellent doctor! #awesome doctor!😄

name: Jenn Sidman
text: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. Not only is the office staff terrible but Michelle Pratt is a terrible provider. She literally treated me like I'm some white trash women off the street. Her bedside manner is atrocious, shes in the wrong line of work. We are a military family so my husband isn't usually around to watch our child for doctor appointments nor do I have any family or friends in the area to help. Well I have never been treated so poorly for bringing my baby to an appointment. How about praising Moms for seeking help when they have no support network in the area. Way to be an advocate for Moms, great job!! Oh this was all while waiting 50 minutes over my appointment time. Which is a regular occurrence when going to see her. I've gone three times now and every time I've had to wait well over an hour. I've never left a provider feeling as disrespected and upset as I did today. She doesn't know me from a hole in the wall and for her to treat me the way she did was disgusting. Do you self a favor and find a different doctors office!!!

name: Sarah Beth
text: I love how nice Dr Alrefai and Huda are. They really do help me with my anxiety and depression. However, with their recent change of their customer service regarding the phones, I am not so pleased on this. I can no longer talk with a person about rescheduling an appointment nor talk to anyone unless I leave a voicemail. This is super inconvienent as they have returned my calls either super late or not at all.

name: Nicol Prochnow
text: Dr. Alrefai was an amazing fit for me.  He was patient and thorough which is tough to find in his field.  I've had to move out of state and can't find anyone as wonderful!

name: Jeska Lewis
text: Great doctor, takes great care of his patients. Also no long wait times. .love him! 5 stars, hands down!

name: KimmyBS
text: Dr Alrefai is the BEST in his field! He is very smart and very learned. He listens and hears what you say. He is not your typical 'NUT' Psychiatrist!

name: Rachel S
text: The girl that called me back about an appointment was so incredibly rude that I had to tell her I didn’t want to be seen by the doctor because of her attitude. Dr Alrefai if these are the people answering your phones I don’t know how you keep patients.

name: Jennifer McClure
text: Very polite, caring ppl

name: Deborah Cazalas
text: Been seeing Dr. Al for awhile, I never want to change doctors.

name: Melissa Dean
text: He listens, does his job and makes me laugh.

name: Nita Jones
text: Best Doc ever

name: Patrick Bezotte (P.M Bezy)
text: I was reading the negative reviewes on here and they are completely frivolous and ignorant if I do say so my self the staff are awesome very helpful and genuinely care as well as the doctor.  She is a very good doctor going out of her way ,above and beyond ,helping every person matters to her  and the staff as well. They do take insurance as you should well know not all insurance is accepted in any doctor's office and for the first negative review I read I am completely appalled at the ignorance of her review sickening really. I hope you give them a chance I have no doubt you will be anything but cared for with the utmost respect and compassion. As long as you are honest and have a genuine problem they will do everything they can to help you on your way to recovery if possible.

name: Douglas George
text: Dr. Lachlan truly cares about the well being of her patients and puts there priorities above her own. She goes above and beyond when talking with her to make sure you feel comfortable and at ease. Amazing doctor! The only downside is the waiting period. Sometimes the office gets backed up and the waiting process can be a bit frustrating. Other than that I have no issues with this doctor.

name: Rita Tuck
text: Dr. Lachman is an excellent doctor. She really cares about her patients. She has helped me so much over the years. I really appreciate her. She enjoys what she does. I would not be where I am today without her. I have had many doctors over the years and she is by far the best.

name: Will Taylor
text: Dr Lachman is one of the best psychologist I have had, she listens extremely well and she goes out of her way to help you with your problems.

name: Tina Hairel
text: I love love Dr Elizabeth Lachman herself and I love how she listens and cares but my beef with them is you can wait for hours and hours to be seen! Plan an all day trip to her office mark everything off your day but sitting in her office! I believe their are just too many people wanting to see her than she can handle she does the best she can and is always apologetic!  For all she has done for me over the years I would give her 5 stars but that waiting time and then not answering the phone is the bad things!

name: Rebecca Garner
text:
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

Sometimes you may sit just a lil past your scheduled appt time & other times you may sit a couple hours past your appt, BUT it is WELL WORTH the wait.. I have been going to Dr. Lauchman for several years now. She treats me like family. Not only does she ask abt my physical and mental health, she will ask abt each individual family member that I have ever talked abt. That goes to show how well she pays attention to her patients.. I wldnt feel no where near as comfortable with someone else...

name: Sally Atchley
text: I am not a patient but I have to drive a patient of hers to and from the office. The wait time is any were from 4 hours up to 8 and 9 hours. Not enough chairs for the patients to sit in.  One bathroom. There was at least 20 people in small waiting area, not enough seats for them, and still more outside. The appointment was at 2pm and she is still waiting at 8:10 pm. They do not have a water cooler so the people who do not take anything have nothing to drink for this long and people with diabetes have no food unless they take some for 6 hours. Not professional at all to book all these appointments for one day!!!!!!!!! Nothing professional about this office at all!!!!! She may be a good Doctor but I find it cruel to make these people wait in such sorry conditions for so long!! A lot of these people have physical health problems and it is very hard on them to wait this long!! This office needs improvements or if the building can't be improved then it needs to be somewhere else.  And someone needs to learn how to schedule appointments appropriately! Thank God I am not a patient and I pray for those patients trapped there for hours and hours and hours!!!!

name: Michael Wood
text: Dr. Lachman is a one of a kind psychiatrist. She is a great listener, she is very compassionate, and is very thorough. She never rushes her patients. You may experience a long wait time, but IT IS WELL WORTH IT. She is a wonderful psychiatrist, and a lovely person, and I revere her with my utmost respect. She has thorough clinical experience with not just common psychiatric medicines for common courses of illnesses, but also with uncommon psychiatric medicines and psychiatric medical combinations for treatment-resistant conditions. Definitely recommend her.

name: Melissa Rae Harvell
text: I would actually give Dr. LACHMAN MORE Stars if at all possible. I can honestly say she was the absolute best I've ever been too. I haven't had not one even halfway decent one since. She's one of almost non-existent Dr. 's that does listen and she does Care. She doesn't let her ego treat her patients, she does and she does it to the best of her ability and I can attest to this. She has literally saved my life in the past more than once. And she helped my children more than she will ever know because despite their young aged they still remember her. As for myself I am and will remain beyond GREATFUL my life's Long.

name: Angie Lang
text: New contract with Medicaid not worked out yet. Go by her office she may have samples she will give you.

name: aubrey harris
text: She is the best Dr. I found in years besides her husband Dr, Mcintire, which I just recently found out that he was her Husband and has passed. She is an excellent listener. She goes above and beyond for her patients even The waiting is Hard But it sure is worth it. She has waited till almost 9 oclock at night to make sure a patient was seen. She gives you really great feed back and she knows her job. I am blessed to have found her.

name: Thesia Smith
text: The worst office staff in history.. they are not  knowledgeable or perceptive about appointments..  and they do not care about the patients at all they would rather look like big bad ass as they're in control and actually help people.. the family and I will not be back ever!

name: Addie Grace
text:
My wife was seeing Doctors in Birmingham and Boaz before getting to see Dr. Lachman. Ever since that 1st visit, she has won my wife’s heart over and mine as well for being able to listen to my wife through all of the hard times(passing of friends & family members & hard times as a child) she’s going through and stuff that we’re going through as a marriage. She is truly a Doctor who cares for her patients and is willing to take however long you need to talk and get things off of your chest. I’m so glad my wife found a Doctor she can open up too and trust fully 100%. Dr. Lachman has been a miracle for my wife and our little family. Without her, we would be driving to Birmingham 2-3 times a month and seeing Doctors in Boaz who really don’t care for their patients(sees them as a paycheck). She has help change our life around for the best. Altogether, my wife and I are very appreciative for Doctors like Dr. Lachman who has a caring heart, open ears, & a shoulder to lean on. My opinion has never changed for Dr. Lachman and my wife has been with her for about 8 years. Also, it’s really sad about the passing of her husband that happened just about 2-3 years ago. He was a very great man who showed respect to everyone he met. He was a retired Doctor as well but would come to work with Mrs. Lachman 🌹 to help out around the office. The few times I  got to talk to him, he was very nice and caring as well. They were a Power couple on Earth and still will be when the Good Lord calls for Dr. Lachman to reunite with her husband.
(I can see them taking care of the Angels who had a bad day and just needs someone to vent too.)

Thank you Dr. Lachman for everything you have done for my wife and our little family. You have been a blessing for us and we are very appreciative of all the help you have given us throughout these many years and We hope you will always be around for years and years to come because you are definitely a 1 out of a million type of person/Doctor.

Thanks 🙏🏼 from the Grace Family!

name: Amanda Ferguson
text:
It's been a while since I have posted a review, so it's time for a new one. I posted several years ago, and my opinion has not changed. Dr. Lachlan goes above and beyond for all of her patients. She doesn't forget me, and what I am dealing with. She does whatever is necessary to make me be my best self. I was a mess when I first started seeing her, and I have a ways to go, but I trust she is the only one who can help me. I couldn't deal without her. She has guided me through so much trauma. I can never repay the debt of gratitude I owe her.
Dr. Lachmans staff is another reason I like seeing her. They treat me like a person. Anita and forgive me for forgetting the other lady's name, make sure that I am taken care of while I'm there, by being nice and understanding. They put up with alot from patient's, and continue to smile, treat me with respect, and give me my follow up appointment.
Things have been crazy with covid-19 going around, but they seem to handle it when things get hectic. They are part of the well oiled machine that makes Dr. Lachmans office run. I appreciate the level of professionalism coming from them. Just like raising a child, running an office takes a village.
They have made it priority to make sure that no one leaves the office with covid, by being very careful.
I hope that I am able to see Dr. Lachmans for many years to come. She is helping me through complicated grief. There are very few doctors around here capable of that, Andi have only met one. That is Dr. Lachman. Complicated grief is no joke, and there is no easy fix. It takes time, and lots of effort on behalf of the doctor to show progress. Dr. Lachman has made sure to handle me with care. She knows how to give advice without being offensive, because she knows how to treat people. She gives the level of care that you want for those most important to you. She was the change I needed in my life. Again there is no fix, only coping skills. During my time spent going to her, my quality of life has gotten much better. She listens, she helps, and she makes a difference. How many doctors are really that good? None up next to her. This is the place I get to unload my issues, and she carefully organizes my mind for me.

name: Edwin Sherman
text: She's a great loving doc she really cares about her people she sees

name: Michelle Skelton
text: Dr Lachman has been treating me for years. She is a great doctor who puts her patients needs above her own. Works late hours and makes sure that every patient gets the time and treatment they need. She does everything to accomidate you anyway she can

name: Janine Stone
text: The best Dr. I ever had she loves her patients she allways remembers our names and problems.other Dr.Your a number.I love Dr.Lockman and staff

name: mjm
text: Mrs. Lachman is a wonderful Dr. Compared to the several Drs. I have seen over the years. She seems to genualy listen to me about my struggle with my ongoing illness and is very patient, understanding and informative. The wait is lengthy sometimes but In a world full of division, discrimination and stigma,  the help and kindness that Mrs. Lachman offers is a breath of fresh air that makes it worth it.

name: Keri Williams
text: Best psychiatrist I've EVER been to. Just be prepared to wait 5 hours

name: Steve Falks
text: If you need help this is the best place.... I have been under doctors care since 1986 ....I've been coming here for over a year....she is the best....the office staff is great Anita is wonderful ......people complain that she is rude.......if you act a fool and drug seeking and acting like a fool she will not tolerate a bunch of bullshit. ......I've love the people here......Steve Falks

name: Gaytha Morgan
text: WELL THIS IS NOT A DOCTOR THAT CARES ABOUT HER PATIENTS. I WENT IN WITH MY HUSBAND AND WAS IN TOTAL SHOCK THE WAY THIS OFFICE WAS MANAGED. WHILE MY HUSBAND WAS IN SEEING THE DOCTOR HER SISTER WOULD COME IN AND OUT. SO DID HER HUSBAND. BUT WHAT REALLY GOT ME WAS WHEN HER SISTER BROUGHT A FOLDER IN AND PUT IT ON TOP AND SAID QUICK 200.00 SHE IS JUST HERE FOR MEDICINE.(LAST OFFICE VISIT 2ND VISIT) MY HUSBAND LOST HIS INSURANCE AND WHEN WE GOT THERE WE WAS TOLD THAT IT WILL BE 75.00 MORE DOLLARS. I TOLD HER I DIDN'T HAVE 75.00 MORE ITS ONLY SUPPOSED TO BE 100.00 I WAS TOLD IF MY HUSBAND WANTED HIS MEDICINE THAT HE WOULD COME UP WITH THE EXTRA MONEY. NOW MY HUSBAND IS DISABLED AND THIS OFFICE IS REFUSING HIM HIS RECORDS. WHEN YOU CALL THIS OFFICE THEY ARE VERY RUDE, THEY CHANGE YOUR APPOINTS THEN EXPECT YOU TO PAY 25.00 CAUSE THEY CHANGED YOUR APPOINTMENT.

name: BARBARA STOKLEY
text: Love her but is a wait and worth it

name: Teresa Morgan
text: Dr. Lachman truly cares about me and listens to me.  She is very compassionate and knowledgeable.

name: Billy and Kerri Ford
text:
I've been Dr.lachman patient going on 9 years. The wait sometimes per appointment is lengthy but well worth it.
She's always been carrying,concerned,diligent,and professional in every way you'd expect a doctor to be. Many times I've had severe melt downs. My most personal heartbroken experiences, Dr.lachman has been there and walked me through every step possible to take. She ensures my well being,health,and mindset. Always have i been pleased with the services she had rendered to me.
The staff are family, and very helpful in aiding patients and Dr.lachman. when you are there you feel welcomed, at home, and like family. I love each and everyone there. Thank you for being here for me. Kerri Ford

name: Faye Ahzburjn
text: Dr. Lachman may mean well but she does more talking than listening, tells stories that has nothing to do with me and allows her family to work in the office. They lose my paperwork. They don't handle appoint times the way they should and want you to pay $25 for an appointment that was cancelled over a month ahead of time. The bathroom is disgusting but they want you to go in to give a urine sample.  Her sister and her newer lady in the front office tried to push some MLM junk pills on me to make a quick buck. So did Dr Lachman when I went in for my appointment. I feel like she is only interested in supplying pills, and I hear so many patients talking about how they react on the stuff she gives them. Some people only go for pills. I have real issues and I have problems taking meds. I'm through!

name: Gregory Melcher
text: I've had over 20 surgeries and suffer from PTSD.  This experience qualifies me a a subject matter expert on doctor/patient relationships, medical professionalism, and continuity of care most doctors only swear an oath without belief. Dr. Lachman is the best medical practitioner (bar none) in any field.  She has no peer in her field of Psychiatry and patient care. You will find no better care than Dr. Lachman and her amazing staff provides to her patients. Wait? Yes, you will wait. However; my wait reminds me of when I was a child and Santa was coming tomorrow - I didn't mind at all.

name: Heather Smith
text: Dr Lachlan is the most wonder person I have ever come to trust. Like someone else said "she put everyone elses needs be her own". I have been seeing her for years and she's the best phych doctor I have ever had.

name: Karen Lawless
text: OFFICE PERSONAL IS RUDE!!!!!!!!! I CALLED AND ASKED WHAT TYPE OF THERAPY SHE SPECIALIZED IN? THE LADY, LAUGHED AND RUDELY SAID WHAT DO YOU MEAN SHE"S A PSYCHIATRIST SHE CAN DO ANYTHING.....  I've called several other places and they simply told me, children's therapy, couples counseling, drug and addiction therapy..... THIS PLACE IS SO RUDE < I HUNG UP,  NOT A PLACE I WOULD EVEN CONSIDER GOING TO AFTER THAT!!!!

name: Alpha and Omega The Creator
text: She trys to take as much time with you as she can. Just try to have patients with her it will be worth it.

name: Brandi Cowart
text: how do you get in touch with this dr? I've called for a month at random times-- no answer!

name: Natalie
text: She is the best. She take the time to listen.

name: Hannah Lowe
text: Dr Lachman is such a sweetheart but some of her office staff can be rude at times.

name: sara jones
text: I was seeing Dr Roza for 7 years. She helped me get stable on the medications that helped me so much. I was having a hard time and went to a different Doctor that specialized in a specific issue that needed medical attention. I HAD to get this issue addressed.  When I told her about what and why this was going on her personality changed and she became so judmental. It was hard enough admitting what I was going going through, but to then be judged by my trusted doctor. And I was judged!  After a 7 year relationship I was shocked and heartbroken. She not only judged me she labled me with her words. She then me  cut me off medications that needed weaning. I was fine with her wanting me off of them, but the way she did it was odd. She didn't wean me, so I eneded up seeing another Psychiatrist to to just that. She is a good doctor until you have issues arise that seem to make her uncomfortable or she does not have much knowledge in that specific area. I was sad this happened and I was heartbroken she treated me this way.

name: Christi Parker
text: Dr. Roza is an excellent doctor and she is very kind. Love her!

name: Amber Roy
text: Trusting very sincere understanding. I would recommend her to everyone.

name: Rene Jamison
text: Poor if I could give a zero I would. I went into their office for the first time.  I was told that I was not a good fit for there care at their office by the receptionist at the desk. Apparently they don’t treat people with mental illness.

name: Jessica Saxon
text: This review goes to Nathan at Southern Psychiatry. I've never been to therapy before in my life and was utterly nervous about going my first time. Nathan was not only reassuring but he was compassionate, understanding, and attentive to my needs and helped me in ways I honestly never thought possible. Hes extremely cool and just overall easy to talk to and he feels like your best friend. He works out plans that are best for you and YOUR needs. There is laughing and so much healing within this one hour its unbelievable. I'm so happy I found the best therapist EVER. Please go see Nathan guys. Hes so awesome!

name: Shannon Lundgren
text: I have seen several providers at Southern Psychiatry for about 18 months.  In that time, the initial concerns which drove me to seek help from them were not addressed, nor did any of the staff adequately explain to me why they gave me the diagnosises they did.  I also had to remind the healthcare providers why I was there on followup visits.  Their front office - when you can get them to answer the phone - are in capable of telling you when your appointment is or which of your medical records you are legally entitled to.  Try literally any other place first.

name: Ki Freeman
text: The ONLY reason I give them 3 stars is because of Dr. Sadler.  It took weeks for me to get an appointment, well I guess I should say a call back for an appointment.   Dr. Sadler was extremely thorough and answered all my questions during my video call.  It took them MONTHS to bill me after my insurance company processed the claim.  The website did not seem very secure to make payment so I attempted to call and make payment over the phone.  Almost 2 weeks later and 2 voice mails and I finally gave up and mailed my payment.  No call back to this day.  I hope my payment that I sent over a week ago is applied to my balance and that I am not put in collections.  Very disappointing and tough on my mental health.....

name: Meep Meeperson
text: Dr. Sadler and Mr. Nathan are wonderful

name: Kimberly Rossler
text: I really want to like this practice bc I see the PA Valerie who is beyond amazing! But not once has Dr.Sadler been involved with my treatment. Valerie is amazing but not a psychiatrist so it’s hard for me to believe I am getting the help that’s needed bc a actual DR should be the one diagnosing me . The office is pure horrible! Don’t even try calling ! I only will email instead of calling so I have a record to prove communication with the office staff. If you leave a voicemail you’ll be called back days later. I am trying to get help with my mental illness but it’s really hard at this place when the office staff will test your patience . It’s not a professional place at all and it’s sad!

name: Joe Pitts
text: Dr. Sadler is amazing, Miranda is phenomenal, I love when we chat, and Nicole is phenomenal! Thank You guys so much!

name: Emily Horn
text: The most thorough and friendly staff Ive ever been to. Ive been seeing mental health professionals for over 10 years and have never been as impressed as I am with this place.

name: RKN RBN
text:
Valerie is FANTASTIC. My previous Dr closed her practice, what a blessing in disguise that ended up being! Valerie is so personable.
My experience at SP has been top notch. I highly recommend them.

name: Steven
text: The doctors are fine, well at least the one I've seen. They are also quick to fix any issues brought to their attention.

name: Tammie Walter
text: Dr Sadler is the best.. Let him help you!

name: Michelle Jackson

text: I feel comfortable with Dr. Cristal. I have seen her a couple of times. She is professional and explains my medicines and reason for lab test. I did have a problem with a medicine at the drugstore but she got my message and worked it out. I like that she offers late evening appointments. She saw me on my lunch one time. Thank u

text: The doctors and staff at Southern Psychiatry are amazing.  They are kind, caring and want to help figure out the best treatment for you.  I had the best experience.  Thank You Southern Psychiatry.  Also love the therapy dog.

name: LeAnn Miller
text: Very unprofessional. Doctor Crystal was extremely forgetful, phone staff was rude and almost never returned my calls. Doctor Crystal made excuses for rude staff, they're hard to get ahold of because they won't answer the phone, had issues trying to refill prescriptions. They couldn't find my consent form to release medical records so they said they'd fax a new form for me to sign and they never did. Waited 45 minutes for an appointment with Dr. Bennett before they told me someone should have told me I was supposed to be in a different waiting room. Had testing set up with Dr. Bennet's office and they cancelled the day before. Found out they lied about why it was cancelled. Told me they accepted Medicaid and had no copay but after two appointments they called and told me I needed a referral from my primary care Doctor in order for Medicaid to pay which they NEVER mentioned before and said I owe over $200. Felt like doctor Crystal didn't listen and overall felt like they didn't care whatsoever. This place added to my anxiety and was probably the worst mental health clinic I've been to.

name: Jamie
text: The staff are nice enough and the lady I saw was polite, reasonable, and down-to-earth.  However, two huge issues. 1.) she seemed to be working on an almost assembly line sort of protocol and took a very short time to listen to my concerns and prescribed medications that gave me multiple concerns due to potential side effects I wanted to avoid 2.) the lady with whom they scheduled my appointment also did not have her insurance credentials in order so I ended up paying 155.00 out of pocket. I have excellent insurance and I would have had zero copay if she could’ve accepted my insurance. I paid because they assured me that by the time my follow up appointment was scheduled they would have the situation remedied. I called before I went to the next appointment and was advised she still didn’t have credentials for united healthcare so the visit would cost 90.0. I canceled the appointment and will have to find another doctor. This has also left me dealing with the side effects of those medications without any support in handling that. All around, I do not advise going here. The building is not handicap accessible which makes it more difficult for me as I don’t do that well with stairs sometimes, they don’t seem to have their business in order, they don’t seem to take the time to truly understand your issue and act appropriately, and I was left with a strong impression that they simply didn’t care much. If anything they should have said come into your appointment and we will not charge you and will handle the insurance after the fact. I do not understand why they think it is acceptable to force a patient to pay their outrageous prices for twenty minutes of their time when it’s their fault they’re not getting paid through insurance. Perhaps they have resolved the issue, perhaps not, but definitely call and question absolutely everything they tell you because they seemed to have no problem surprising me not only once with a bill I shoudn’t have had to pay, but they didn’t even call me before the follow up to advise me I would again be required to pay out of pocket.

He brings a dog to work with him that uses the restroom on the floor. The receptionist that obtains urine for drug screens just leaves the urine laying around in open areas. The management team is unprofessional as well. Unethical behavior on charging patients for no show visits even after the patients call to reschedule appointments.  Worst service ever.

name: Kimberly
text: I do NOT recommend this doctor’s office.  I agree with every negative review posted about them: The office is unappealing, but that can be overlooked.  People have complained about the receptionists, but they were nice to me.  People were charged no-show fees and co-pays when while on their insurance they have never owed a co-pay: the latter happened to me.  Someone said they treat you like a drug addict and I can see that as well.  You are drug screened before you see a doctor on your first visit.  Oh, and you have to use a public restroom in the main hallway of the building and carry your urine sample to them in plain view for anyone to see.  Other complaints have been about the apathy of the doctors, and I can relate to that as well.  I requested a refill for my medication 10 days before I was to run out and the doctor said she wrote me enough pills to get me to my next appointment plus 1 refill when in actuality my prescription bottle and the copy of the electronic prescription I got directly from the pharmacy shows otherwise, and in fact a lot less.

name: John Sullivan
text: My Wife preparing for a surgery in a few months and one of the requirements of her surgery is a Psych Eval.  Appointment was made with this physicians office.  Upon arriving, she's told that she has not met her deductible and that the visit would be $152.00, which doesn't make sense as she has already had surgery this year and multiple test done.  She had her debit card but had paid bills the day prior (of course) and only had $94.00.  The physician said he would see her for $100.00 but she only had $94.00 so she was not seen.   Now even though she was thoroughly embarrassed over the entire situation, she had rescheduled for another day.    Two weeks later, we get a bill in the mail charging a $100.00 NO SHOW fee.  Now I understand that they want their money in advance but ...she wasn't a NO SHOW.  The physician's office refused to see her.  I'm sorry this seems very tacky.  Now they've lost out on both ends as they lost a potential patient and she's refused to pay their NO SHOW fee.   Maybe it should be a Not Seen Fee...........

name: Amber Turrentine
text:
While I have never attended a session, I did reach out to schedule an appointment. I left a message and received a call back the next day. The receptionist said that there wouldn't be any new patient appointments until mid March. This is pretty common for first visits. My concern came when she asked for my credit or debit card number. When I asked why she seemed somewhat offended. The reason given was in case a don't show for an appointment. I have been to three different practices and not once have I been asked to give out my debit card number over the phone. I said that I didn't feel comfortable doing that and thanked her for her time.

If you dont feel comfortable giving out your debit or credit card number over the phone, I wouldn't suggest this place.

name: Alexandra Stegall
text:
I am a retired veteran that was admitted to this hospital twice during my Service as an active duty soldier at Fort Rucker, AL. I was experiencing PTSD and extreme distress during my service and was admitted to this hospital’s behavioral health unit twice within a year. Here’s my story:

The first time I was admitted, it was voluntary...
I was going through a lot on base, where I lived. My chain of command in the military allowed me to admit myself for a short period of time. They wanted me to get myself together and have me go back to continuing my service.

The neglect for patients here was disgusting to say the least. The staff allowed my chain of command to enter the unit without my password. They were the last people I wanted to see. I was sure that this was illegal and requested to speak to a supervisor, who told me it was my mistake for not turning them away. Being a soldier, I knew she did not understand that I could not do that and she clearly did not care about the law that her staff was breaking. This was not the only kind of neglect I witnessed/experienced. The geriatrics room was so sad. The older patients are sat down in chairs all day and night, in front of a tv. One of the older men was taken into a private room with a female tech. When they came out, he had a bloody mark on his forehead. Some of us patients noticed but felt that nobody would do anything about it. Another older gentleman in the geriatrics room died while I was there. Nobody knew the cause but he was wrapped up in a sheet and placed into a giant gray bin and wheeled away in front of all of the other patients!

During this first stay at this hospital, there was a day where a group of student nurses were visiting to observe the staff and patients. They were observing a therapy group where the therapist was breaking HIPAA laws and verbally exposing each patient’s diagnosis in front of all of the other patients, as well as the student nurses.

The second time I was admitted, I was court ordered. My command knew I was in distress and did not know what to do with me. I was sent to this hospital a second time and knew that it would not be a long stay. I was met by two giant men, telling me I have been court ordered to the psychiatric unit. I knew that something wasn’t right and that the court order was not justified. This time, they admitted me to the third-floor. There were beds available on the second floor but had decided that I would be better off on the third floor. Anyone who has been to this unit, knows that the third floor is for patients with severe mental health issues... this time, there was a poster on the wall with all of the patient rights (that wasn’t there before)... I read all of my rates and noticed that it said that I could request a patient advocate and a lawyer. When I approached the glass window at the desk, I requested Mary Anne, A wonderful recreational therapist that I remembered from my first stay- as well as a lawyer!... I was met with a nasty attitude and told to sit down because I was court ordered. At this point, I was panicking and angry so I threw a fit in order to get the attention of whoever was above this woman telling me to take a seat. When I got the supervisors attention, I requested that lawyer and therapist. The lawyer asked me if I had been “Baker Acted” but I had no idea what that meant. He pulled up my information on a computer and informed me that I had not been “baker acted” and could leave anytime I wanted. I was out of there within a few hours!

What a horrifying experience this was. The neglect and abuse here is disgusting and I would never EVER recommend anyone admit themselves to this hospital!

text: My Psychiatry Clinic is THE BEST! With other mental health offices we have used, we either found a doctor that doesn't seem to really care, rude receptionists, and/or it's almost impossible to get an emergency appointment. You won't find any of that at My Psychiatry! They are nothing but friendly, caring, and compassionate. I will never be able to express my gratitude for what Dr. Islam has done for my family, and to Roman for always working with us and getting us in for an appointment. Absolutely recommended!!

name: Matthew 123456
text:
I moved Back home to Birmingham after struggling for years in Florida with my issues compounded by a lack of available Doctors in Pensacola that could treat me without Insurance currently and with the new Covid guidelines it was nearly impossible to get the help needed there.

By Chance I called Dr. Islam from googling for psychiatrists here and was stunned that he actually answered the phone, then set up an appointment for initial visit the next Day!

I didn't know what to expect and just took a shot at this new video conference method and it went flawless.

On top of the great service, Dr. Islam's true talent showed in the visit and outcome so far.

Somehow he deciphered me trying to explain almost 25 years of taking medication for Depression at first, then anxiety in college,  and a variety of issues ever since.

I knew the best method was not to sugar coat the severity of how bad I have been feeling and that I was basically unable to function normally, except for bare minumum to survive.
I just told him the truth that I was basically staying home and not able to see a way out but that I never gave up hope but that I was in serious need of help.

I told him what I thought I needed based on what had helped in the past; but also that I trust him over my opinion bc obviously my past regiment had not really helped me bc I had stagnated overall even when had all the help I thought I needed over the last 5 years..

Amazingly he was able to understand my root problem better than I did honesly and prescribed a medication that has litterally changed my Life.

For the 1st time in 8 years or so, I feel free from the over whelming anxiety and sadness and fear that had ruled me for a decade and he did it with a novel approach that I didnt even know existed and had never heard of as a medication for my underlying issue of anxiety/depression/and an inablity to take needed action.

How I had never been diagnosed this way or offered this class of medication is just an example of the stigma and problems still around mental health..  Perhaps my previous doctors were influenced by the labels and words used to describe some of my symptoms which caused them to think I didnt need this form of treatment.. I dont know but there are medicines that will help you that you may never have heard of like me.

It actually makes my brain WORK the right way Versus just numbing it, and covering over the problem .

I am now in a position that I am safely tapering off the medication that I dont truly need to be on(faster than I thought I could) and put that "mistake" in the past and I am focused on my life and my future for the first time in years.

Never give up hope! Dont settle for bad help or mediocre treatment that just helps you "get by" each day as long as you have your "meds"

If you not thriving or on a path too it dont settle like I did for way too long.

Dont assume you know the only things that will work for you and be TOTALLY honest with the Dr so he can help you .

Im even getting back into old hobbies and my next new career goals and even back into My Faith in God.

If you or someone you know is struggling please take this as a message of hope that its never too late and never hopeless.

God Bless and Thank you to Dr. Islam and Thanks to President Trump or whoever in the Government made this Tele-Medicine / new video conferencing option available. Without it I may never have found Dr. Islam.

Thank You Dr. Islam

Sincerely,

Matt
